intro: Coccoloba grandis, commonly known as the broadleaf glorybower, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are typically bright green and have a smooth texture. It produces clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in the summer months. Coccoloba grandis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and can thrive in a variety of soil types with adequate sunlight.
